title: Mastering the Decision-Making Process for Scientific Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science theory and experience in operating educational programs
context.additional_context: Aims to improve job-linked science education capabilities for adult learners

learning_goals: Learners can identify over 80% of core decision-making elements at each instructional design stage (analysis-design-development-implementation-evaluation)
Technology integration strategies in science education contexts can be applied to project-based assignments
Evidence-based design decision-making skills improve through literature review (20% enhancement in pre-post assessments)
Learners can create blended teaching method design plans that reflect diverse learner needs
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
